titles.en: Chapter 24 – The one who sees his debtor in the Al-Harram

titles.ar: باب فِيمَنْ رَأَى غَرِيمَهُ فِي الْحَرَمِ
titles.en: Chapter 24 – The one who sees his debtor in the Al-Harram

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ شَاذَانَ بْنِ الْخَلِيلِ أَبِي الْفَضْلِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ لِي عَلَيْهِ مَالٌ فَغَابَ عَنِّي زَمَاناً فَرَأَيْتُهُ يَطُوفُ حَوْلَ الْكَعْبَةِ أَ فَأَتَقَاضَاهُ مَالِي قَالَ لَا لَا تُسَلِّمْ عَلَيْهِ وَ لَا تُرَوِّعْهُ حَتَّى يَخْرُجَ مِنَ الْحَرَمِ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Shazan Bin Al Khaleel Abu Al Fazl, from Sama’at Bin Mihran, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about a man upon whom there was some wealth for me. So he was absent from me for a time, then I saw him circumambulating around the Kabah. Can I ask him for my wealth?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No. Neither greet him nor panic him until he comes out from the Al-Harram’.
